page.title: 19CUSTOMS.
page.content: { School Customs and Events. There was an annual fair on the site of St.Barnabas' School until 1885,when Clifton Green Preservation Society stopped the fair and the bonfire on the green,but they erect a Christmas tree with coloured lights each year.Carlysle Street had a bonfire until they made a park;now,on November 5th there's a bonfire on the playing fields instead.St.Peter's School has a bonfire,but they don't burn a "Guy Fawkes" because he was an old pupil! On St.Barnabas' Day,June 11th,we sing and entertain the old people.We have a May Parade around the local streets.At Christmas we perform a musical play and at Easter the Easter Bunny leaves footprints and eggs in school.We have a Sports Day at the end of the summer term.
